intro: Urgineopsis gracilis, commonly known as the slender urgeon, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Urgineopsis gracilis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories.
